Authors: Dyfed Lloyd Evans, Shailesh Vinay Joshi
Title:
Chloroplast and Mitochondrial Assembly from Transcriptomic
Datasets: Taxonomic Implications
Keywords:
organellar genomes, transcript assembly, phylogenetics,
genome comparison
Abstract:
Background: Though it has been known for almost a decade
that human (and other vertebrate) mitochondria are transcribed in their
entirety, and a recent study demonstrates that the same is true for
plant chloroplasts, transcriptomic datasets have not been used for the
assembly of organellar genomes. This is surprising, given the increasing
rate of submission of transcriptomic datasets to the international
sequence repositories.
